A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I'll put aside all the obvious points well-discussed here. Even if you agree with the \"artistic\" choices\, the third-act was way too long\, had too many false endings\, and there are too many characters\, all competing for screen time to do heroic things\, to care greatly about any of them.\n\nStar Wars now suffers from the same weaknesses that plague so many of the comic book movies now thrown at us from all directions. For the professional movie critics to ignore this in Jedi is a little bit hypocritical.
